headline: CNN News Central
subHeadline: Lee Merritt is Interviewed about a Father Shot by Las Vegas Police; Hallmark Movie Fans Live Out Dream. Aired 9:30-10a ET

utterances.speaker: ZACHARY WOLF, CNN SENIOR POLITICS WRITER
utterances.sentences: Oprah. He's, of course, a surgeon. Then he had his own TV show before he ran for Senate. Most recently, he's been selling, you know, some herbal - some - his alternative medicines online. And now he could be in charge of health insurance for more than 160 million Americans. That's almost a third of the country, people who get Medicare, people who get Medicaid. That's a pretty big job for somebody who's never been in administration before.And it keeps going. I mean Tulsi Gabbard, I looked yesterday, she does have behind - you know, on her resume, she's been on Fox News literally hundreds of times in the past couple of years. She could be the nation's top spy in charge of, you know, the CIA and all these - the NSA, all these other agencies. Robert F. Kennedy Jr. does not have that same relationship with Fox News that the others do, but he did write a bestselling book attacking Anthony Fauci and Bill Gates and alleging all of these conspiracy theories about the U.S. health system that he could now effectively be running. Mike Huckabee, he does not have a Fox News show. He's on a, you know a Christian network. But, you know, this is a theme that he keeps coming back to with all of these picks.

utterances.speaker: JOHN BERMAN, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Dan Bongino may be the guy to run the Secret Service.

utterances.speaker: WOLF
utterances.sentences: Right. You know, very critical - former Secret Service agent. Very critical. Had a Secret Service - or had had a Fox News show, but now he's on this, you know, has a podcast. And it shows that this sort of - the web is getting wider than Fox News, into this kind of larger ecosystem of further right-wing media that were seeing.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: All right, Zack Wolf, great to see you. Thank you so much for sharing your reporting on all this.So, a phrase I only learned for the first time this morning, "gate lice." That's people who board with the wrong group at the airport. Kate Bolduan apparently included. This morning, one of the biggest airlines beginning a high-tech crackdown. So, Kate, beware. (COMMERCIAL BREAK) [09:36:46] KATE BOLDUAN, CNN ANCHOR: New this morning, the FBI says they have foiled a plot to bomb the New York Stock Exchange. This was first reported by the website Court Watch. Now, investigators, they first got a tip in February that a 30-year-old man from Florida was storing, quote/unquote, bomb making schematics in a storage unit. So, an investigation ensued, and they later found sketches and other electronics that could be used for building explosive devices. The FBI says the suspect also told undercover agents he wanted to detonate a bomb at the stock exchange the week before Thanksgiving. And according to court documents, the man told them, quote, "the stock exchange, we want to hit that, because it will wake people up." Also, U.S. wildlife officials are warning that giraffe populations are declining so rapidly they should be considered endangered. Officials say giraffes are disappearing because of a few factors, habitat loss, poaching and drought fueled by the climate crisis. The Fish and Wildlife Service is proposing to make giraffe species either endangered or threatened, which will help, of course, to protect them. And American Airlines is now cracking down online cutters, making it better, or making it even worse, depending on your view, of boarding zones. The airline is rolling out its new boarding technology to 100 airports nationwide. The entire goal, stop line cutters, which they are giving a misnomer to and calling them "gate lice." If you board before your assigned group, the technology will make a sound to grab the attention of the gate agent. What happens next, of course, scorn, shame, and ridicule. The company has been stress testing this system over the last month at airports in New Mexico, Arizona and Virginia. TBD if it actually helps planes take off any faster, but it does just stifle harmless rebellion. Sara.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: The woman who broke in, Boudreaux, faces multiple charges. She told police she intended for them to shoot and kill her, not Durham. The family's attorney, Lee Merritt, is joining us now.My God, these details are beyond disturbing, especially hearing from his daughter. What did you see? We have looked at so many cases. What did you see when you looked at the entirety of that body camera video?

utterances.speaker: LEE MERRITT, ATTORNEY, MERRITT LAW FIRM
utterances.sentences: I see once again a police force that is not only poorly trained, but they almost seem trained to make the wrong decision.Here, we know that officers in Las Vegas Metro, like officers all around the country, they're trained to make an assessment about the situation that they're in and to only use deadly force when confronted with deadly force themselves. In this situation, there's no argument that the - that Officer Alexander Bookman was in danger, or that he was helping to save life. Instead, he was abusing his power in a way that has really devastated this family and this community.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Have the police given you any explanation, and do you have any trust that they will look at this very closely, that they will, you know, really consider whether or not charges need to be filed, especially in that their policies also mandate that the officer ceases firing once the deadly threat is no longer present?

utterances.speaker: MERRITT
utterances.sentences: Yes. Unfortunately, we haven't given - been given any real reassurance that Las Vegas Metro PD will handle this correctly. Unlike many of the - the - the jurisdictions throughout the country, Las Vegas Metro PD investigates themselves. In other words, there is no one there to supervise what they've done. The investigator who will determine whether or not Alexander Bookman committed a crime is from the Las Vegas Metro Police Department, one of his colleagues. And the decision whether or not he'll be terminated is in an internal affairs decision. This is the least accountable police department that I've come across in my career as a civil rights attorney.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: They have been looked at and have been scrutinized by the Justice Department as well.I want to ask you about Mr. Durham, the woman that he was in some sort of relationship with. She told police she wanted to die. She attacked Durham. She was wearing the hoodie and the facemask. She broke into the home, wielded a knife. How much of the blame did the family put on her for what ended up happening?

utterances.speaker: MERRITT
utterances.sentences: She bears an enormous amount of the blame for this incident being instigated. Obviously, she is the intruder. We're learning more information as the weeks go on. But we know that there was a previous relationship that law enforcement, even possibly Officer Bookman had been called to the scene before. So, they would have been familiar with the actors. That makes this ten times worse because not only did they receive a description of the intruder that night, someone wearing a ski mask, someone wearing a hoodie, and not only did they have a description of Brandon himself, Mr. Durham himself, but it seems that the law enforcement officers who responded to the scene that night were already familiar with these actors. And that makes the - the firing on the homeowner, in their home, when they made a 911 call, that much less tolerable.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: I cannot help but go back to Durham's 15-year-old daughter. Is she being given help? I mean what she experienced is too much to bear for anyone. She is 15. Is she getting help and - and how is she getting through this?

utterances.speaker: MERRITT
utterances.sentences: It was less than a week ago that she was an earshot away in the hallway that the officer tested in the video - in the body cam video before slaying her father. This is going to be very difficult for her. They have not yet had - made a decision about Mr. Durham's final resting place. Obviously, this case has gotten - garnered national, if not international attention. And so - and her face has been circulated throughout media as she makes a desperate cry for justice, just this past Friday.She is being plugged in with mental health resources. Unfortunately, she's become a part of a community of people who have endured this kind of trauma. We know that we live in the deadliest police culture in the industrialized world. We see these kind of shootings about three times a day in this country. And so there's a community of people and a process in place to help her process this grief. But one way we can deal with it is by ensuring that Officer Alexander Bookman is held accountable.

utterances.speaker: MERRITT
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: All right, if you have been to the airport lately, there is a very good chance you have stood in front of a kiosk to help you speed through security and get on board, or been annoyed by those who are passing you who do that. It works by scanning your so-called biometrics. In other words, taking a good hard look at your facial and body features to make sure it's you. And they're operated by a company called Clear. It's CEO, Caryn Becker, tells me she's got huge plans to use this technology well beyond airports.Take a listen (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: CARYN BECKER, CEO, CLEAR
utterances.sentences: Today, let's just say you live in L.A. You could use it getting into an Uber for rider verification within the rider app. And then let's say you're going to the Intuit Dome to watch a Clippers game. You can buy beer at the Clippers game with just your face and Clear.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: It is supposed to make your life a lot more smoother. Caryn Becker is our view first "Game Changer" in our series. She - see what else she has to say when we share more of the interview tomorrow morning, 9

utterances.speaker: BOLDUAN
utterances.sentences: Yes. Well, Sara.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: I'm just saying.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: We are finalists for the fan of the year award.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Comes a love story -

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Hi.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: That's a real "Christmas Gamechanger." UNIDENTIFIED MALE

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: You do?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes, the lucky Christmas hat.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: We only get to the Super Bowl if someone in our family wears the hat on Christmas.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Oh, OK.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Do you not believe me?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I just need to see some of that Christmas magic for myself.OK, that's pretty good. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Oh, it's happening. It's that time of year again. John's favorite time when a woman from a big city moves to a small town and she meets, amazingly, this cute, often wealthy guy and holiday romance ensues. It's just like life.

utterances.speaker: BOLDUAN
utterances.sentences: There is no cynicism for - between this.Come on, Sara.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: All right. Fine. It's Hallmark Christmas movie season, y'all. We do need some love in our life. If you can't get enough of these romantic holiday movies, Hallmark offered a chance at happily ever after with a Christmas cruise, complete with a meet and greet with some favorite Hallmark heartthrobs.And we get to talk to several women who just happen to have gotten off that cruise and they are so cruise ready right now you will not believe it.

utterances.speaker: BOLDUAN
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: We love your outfits.

utterances.speaker: ROSEANN ROGERS, HALLMARK CHRISTMAS CRUISE PASSENGER
utterances.sentences: Yes, we did.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: So, we've got Tracy, from left to right, Roseann, Lara and Suzanne.

utterances.speaker: ROGERS
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Ladies, first of all, how was the cruise?

utterances.speaker: ROGERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. Great! We're Christmas-ized (ph). We're ready.

utterances.speaker: LARA BELL,  HALLMARK CHRISTMAS CRUISE PASSENGER
utterances.sentences: It was - it was amazing. It truly was amazing. And what's funny is, we signed up for this cruise in July of 2023. So, we've been waiting a long time for this cruise.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Wow. Did you meet the man of your dreams?

utterances.speaker: ROGERS
utterances.sentences: And it was well worth it. And it delivered. Let me tell you. It was unbelievable.Of course, lots of Hallmark hunks. You got it.

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: Tons.

utterances.speaker: ROGERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: Hallmark hunk. I love that.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: That's good.

utterances.speaker: ROGERS
utterances.sentences: They were all there.

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: We did. They were all there.

utterances.speaker: BOLDUAN
utterances.sentences: Why (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes. Oh, yes. And not only that, when we were on the cruise, they were looking for a new Hallmark hunk to star in an upcoming movie. So, they were running all these contests for people on the ship.

utterances.speaker: BOLDUAN
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: ROGERS
utterances.sentences: There's a new show called "Finding Mr. Christmas," and it's a reality show looking for the next Hallmark hunk. And you've got to watch it. It's really good. Jonathan Bennett is the host. He was actually our host on the cruise. And he did a great job. So, we got to see a lot of things that people haven't seen yet on the Hallmark Channel.

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: I think John - I think John needs to apply.

utterances.speaker: ROGERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, John, come on.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: I don't have a lot of free time.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: We knew you were going to do that.

utterances.speaker: BOLDUAN
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: I mean I'm free after 10

utterances.speaker: BOLDUAN
utterances.sentences: You're a CNC hunk.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: All right (ph).

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Yes. BELL

utterances.speaker: BOLDUAN
utterances.sentences: What - tell me about - what did you guys do on the cruise?

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BOLDUAN
utterances.sentences: Like, how was this different from other cruises and what is - I have a favorite Hallmark movie, but is there - do you guys have consensus on your favorite one?

utterances.speaker: ROGERS
utterances.sentences: Well, there's lots of favorites. We like the - we've got Heidelberg Holiday, Biltmore - the Biltmore Christmas is one of our faves.

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: Very favorites.

utterances.speaker: ROGERS
utterances.sentences: And then we got to see a new movie that hasn't even aired yet on the Hallmark Channel called, uh, wait three mile - wait, three -

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: Wiser - three wise men -

utterances.speaker: ROGERS
utterances.sentences: Three wiser men and a boy.

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: ROGERS
utterances.sentences: And it premiers on the Hallmark Channel on -

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: November 30th.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: The wine's taken over, clearly.

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: So special is everybody decorated their doors (INAUDIBLE) hang on their doors. And so it's just super fun. It's really, really fun to see everybody. And the people watching was amazing.

utterances.speaker: ROGERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, it was. And all the outfits, because everyone was in pajamas or Christmas outfits, like ours, of course.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: My question is, if this were -

utterances.speaker: ROGERS
utterances.sentences: There - there it is. That's it.

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: That's the hallways.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: That's fantastic. That's awesome.If this were an actual Hallmark special about four friends going on a cruise like this, how would it end?

utterances.speaker: ROGERS
utterances.sentences: Oh, gosh.

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: We'd all be in love.

utterances.speaker: ROGERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, all be in love.

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: We'd all be living in a small town.

utterances.speaker: ROGERS
utterances.sentences: Uh-huh.

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: I mean, we would all be just super happy.

utterances.speaker: ROGERS
utterances.sentences: I would open a retail store or a bakery, right?

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: I'd be the doctor. I'd be the town doctor.

utterances.speaker: ROGERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, there you go. There you go. Tracy would be the IT tech person so, you know.

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: ROGERS
utterances.sentences: And Suzanne would be our travel planner because she's the one who actually got us on the cruise. Persistence, let me tell you, ladies, persistence, persistence, persistence. If it wasn't for Suzanne, we would not be standing here today. She did it.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Here's the best ending, they're on CNC. That's the real love.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: That's right. They'd end up on CNN.

utterances.speaker: BOLDUAN
utterances.sentences: This is where - this is - that is exactly how the Hallmark movie is supposed to end, guys.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: With our CNC hunk.

utterances.speaker: BOLDUAN
utterances.sentences: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: Roseann, Lara, Tracy and Suzanne, thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: Glad it was so much fun. I have to say, I'm actually a shadow - a big fan of these shows.

utterances.speaker: BOLDUAN
utterances.sentences: He is.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: They only make people smile, and that's a good thing.

utterances.speaker: BOLDUAN
utterances.sentences: This is true. I like "Christmas Cookies."

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: Oh, I love it.

utterances.speaker: BOLDUAN
utterances.sentences: That's - that's - that's - no, it's the name of one of the movies.

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: That's a good one.

utterances.speaker: BOLDUAN
utterances.sentences: It's really, really good.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BOLDUAN
utterances.sentences: It is really nice to meet you guys. Thank you.
